Detailed Description

Manages the input of characters by the multi-tap method. E. g. pressing the key 2 once results in an 'a', pressing key 2 twice results in 'b'.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum MultiTapInputMapper::CapitalizationMode
 

Defines the mode which is used for the capitalization of characters.

Enumerator:
UserTriggeredCapitalization  The user must explicitly switch between upper and lower case.
AutoCapitalization  After a punctuation mark followed by a blank the next character is switched to upper case automatically.
NameCapitalization  After a blank the next character is switched to upper case automatically. This mode is useful for editing names.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MultiTapInputMapper::MultiTapInputMapper (  BOOLEAN  show_preview = TRUE,
Alphabet  alphabet = InputMapper::Ucs2Alphabet,
CapitalizationMode  capitalization_mode = UserTriggeredCapitalization
)  [explicit]
 

Parameters:
show_preview If set to TRUE, a small box containing the available characters to a key is popped up dynamically.
alphabet The multitap input-mapper may be configured to any kind of alphabet defined in GPP TS 23038 V430 (2001-09). Note that the paging-map-entries defined in LocaleConfig::GetPagingMap should correspond to the alphabet, otherwise the character will not be inserted by the input-mapper.
capitalization_mode Defines the capitalization mode (see CapitalizationMode). Per default the mode CapitalizationMode::UserTriggeredCapitalization is used.
